column4: has anyone here installed ubuntu on a system that has NO operating system on it by default?
yeah
did u go the booting ubuntu installer from usb route?
i'm sure many of us have.  it's a pretty common thing.
i've done it from usb and dvd
how did you create your usb disk?
unfortunately, booting usb still has a lot of problems. =/
what machine is it?  you might be able to find people who have done the same thing.
also, it sounds like you may have done the usb creation wrong.  it seems like it's finding a bootable device, but not the bootable partition.
hm.... what do you mean? i dl'ed the ubuntu 9.10 iso, opened up unetbootin, specified iso and then it created it onto my usb drive
oooh, you know, another thing is that not all usb devices are bootable.  some of them have firmware updates available that make them bootable.
is there any alternative other than USB / cd / floppy to installing ubuntu? can i do a network install or anything ?
you could boot over the network, but that's pretty involved.
what kind of usb drive are you trying to boot from?
this is an Ativa 2GB
looks like other people are having boot problems with that flash device...
*usb device
do you have a different usb stick you can use?
woah thanks, how did u know that others were having problems with it? also yeah i can find another usb device, would u recommend any? (i can buy from walmart real quick)
google told me.
can i pm u?
sure
